Legal_Issue: Whether the CHRC's dismissal of the applicant's discrimination complaint is reasonable under the Canadian Human Rights Act
Application_Facts: Guy Lafond filed a discrimination complaint alleging harassment and differential treatment at work based on age, sex, and disability
Decision_Outcome: The CHRC dismissed the complaint due to insufficient evidence; the court upheld the decision in judicial review
Court_Ruling: The court dismissed the judicial review application, upholding the CHRC's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Alleged harassment and differential treatment in the workplace
Assessment_Factor: Sufficiency of evidence for differential treatment
Procedural_Issue: Complaint dismissal after investigation and review of representations
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subparagraph 44(3)(b)(i) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Application_Basis: Insufficient evidence to warrant an inquiry
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of sufficient evidence of differential treatment
Relief_Sought: Judicial review of CHRC's dismissal of the complaint
Governing_Rule: Under subparagraph 44(3)(b)(i), CHRC may dismiss a complaint if an inquiry is not warranted
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence of differential treatment based on protected grounds
Outcome: Complaint dismissed by CHRC; judicial review dismissed
Cause_Description: Guy Lafond alleged workplace discrimination and harassment on the basis of age, sex, and disability
Evidence_Handling: Reviewed investigator report and party representations
Evidence_Issues: No sufficient evidence found to support claim
Legal_Provision: Subparagraph 44(3)(b)(i) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Evidence_Assessment: Investigator found no sufficient evidence of discriminatory treatment
Decision_Rationale: Dismissal was reasonable as it fell within acceptable outcomes based on facts and law
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of supporting evidence for allegations
